wikipedia_page.main: The Honourable Julian Charles Fane (27 May 1927 – 13 December 2009) was a British author.

response: Three novels by William Nicholson (writer) – The Secret Intensity of Everyday Life, All the Hopeful Lovers and Golden Hour – are based in Lewes and surrounding villages. Three Round Towers and Retribution by Beverley Elphick are set in and around Lewes at the end of the 18th century. Hope Cottage by Julian Fane is about a family who swap their flat in London for their friends' cottage in Lewes for twelve months.

Among his grandchildren were Simon Fraser, 15th Lord Lovat and 4th Baron Lovat (1911–1995), Sir Hugh Fraser (1918–1984), the Secretary of State for Air from 1962 to 1964, David Fane, 15th Earl of Westmorland (1924–1993), Julian Fane (1927–2009), the author.

link_mentions.page: List of people from Lewes, East Sussex

response: * Julian Fane (diplomat) (1827–1870), British diplomat and poet
* Julian Fane (author) (1927–2009), British author, kinsman of the above
* Julian Fane (musician), Canadian artist from Vancouver
